sections.title: Cookies on the NHS website
paragraphs: We've put some small files called cookies on your device to make our site work.

We'd also like to use analytics cookies. These collect feedback and send information about how our site is used to services called Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Qualtrics Feedback and Google Analytics. We use this information to improve our site.
Let us know if this is OK. We'll use a cookie to save your choice. You canread more about our cookiesbefore you choose.
You can change your cookie settings at any time using ourcookies page.

If you or someone you know needs help with day-to-day living because of illness or disability, this website explains your options and where you can get support.

sections.title: Introduction to care and support
paragraphs: A quick guide for people who have care and support needs and their carers

sections.title: Help from social services and charities
paragraphs: Includes helplines, needs assessments, advocacy and reporting abuse

sections.title: Care services, equipment and care homes
paragraphs: Includes home adaptations, help at home from a paid carer, staying safe and housing

sections.title: Money, work and benefits
paragraphs: How to pay for care and support, and where you can get help with costs

sections.title: Care after a hospital stay
paragraphs: Includes hospital discharge and care and support afterwards

sections.title: Support and benefits for carers
paragraphs: Includes carer's assessments, support from local councils, respite care and help for young carers

sections.title: Practical tips if you care for someone
paragraphs: Includes advice on challenging behaviour, moving and lifting people and medicines

sections.title: Caring for children and young people
paragraphs: Services, support and tips if you care for someone under 21, and moving to adult social services

sections.title: Making decisions for someone else
paragraphs: Includes powers of attorney and mental capacity
